items.name: Geofabric (BoM)
items.description:
The Australian Hydrological Geospatial Fabric (Geofabric) is a specialised Geographic Information System (GIS). It registers the spatial relationships between important hydrological features such as rivers, water bodies, aquifers and monitoring points. By detailing the spatial dimensions of these hydrofeatures and how they are connected, it is possible to analyse how water is stored, transported and used through the landscape.

The quality of the spatial data and attribution is largely based upon the input data from AusHydro and ANUDEM Streams and the National Catchment Boundaries. Additional post-processing of these feature classes creates the resulting feature classes within the Geofabric products.

items.name: Water Regulations Data (BoM)
items.description:
The Bureau of Meteorology (Bureau) receives water data, measured at stations around Australia, from organisations named in the Water Regulations (2008). A large proportion of the Water Regulations (2008) data given to the Bureau is made available to the public via Sensor Observation Service (SOS2) web services, providing nationally consistent, up to date and historical water data (and related information). Time series data collected from approximately 6500 measurement stations across Australia are available. NEII uses these web services to present the following eight data subcategories:
  • Watercourse Level (Water Regulations subcategory 1a)
  • Watercourse Discharge (Water Regulations subcategory 1b)
  • Storage Level (Water Regulations subcategory 3a)
  • Storage Volume (Water Regulations subcategory 3b)
  • Electrical Conductivity of surface water @ 25C (Water Regulations subcategory 9a)
  • Turbidity of surface water (Water Regulations subcategory 9d)
  • pH of surface water (Water Regulations subcategory 9g)
  • Temperature of surface water (Water Regulations subcategory 9h)
The above data subcategories are also available in the Water Data Online product. There may be more stations available on the 'Water Regulations Data (BoM)' network as it updates automatically using web services and includes all stations for which the subcategory of data has been delivered to the Bureau, not just the quality assured ones. Water Data Online only provides access to data that has undergone the Bureau of Meteorology's data quality assurance processes.

items.name: Watercourse Level
items.description:
Watercourse level, as defined by subcategory 1a of the Water Regulations 2008 – refer to [Subcategories of Water Information](http://www.bom.gov.au/water/regulations/subCategoriesWaterAuxNav.shtml#surfWater). This data is shown as provided to the Bureau of Meteorology by data owner organisations and is subject to their terms and conditions of use. Please refer to Copyright on the [Water Data Online](http://www.bom.gov.au/waterdata/) website, and [Disclaimer](http://www.bom.gov.au/other/disclaimer.shtml) statements relating to the use of Bureau of Meteorology material.
The stations represented by the 'Water Regulations Data (BoM)', and the 'Water Data Online (BoM)' networks in the Environmental Monitoring Sites Register on the NEII viewer are essentially the same.  Stations are only released onto the 'Water Data Online (BoM)' networks once a series of high level checks have been completed.  There may be more stations available on the 'Water Regulations Data (BoM)' network as it updates automatically using web services and includes all stations for which the subcategory of data has been delivered to the Bureau, not just the quality assured ones.

items.name: Queensland watercourse and water area web map service (Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy, Queensland Government)
items.description: This web map service displays the watercourse network and areas of inland surface water in Queensland. Water areas include lakes,reservoir and man-made canals. This service is limited to display at scales between 1:4,513 and 1:1, and is designed to be used in conjunction with the WaterCoursesAndBodiesCache service for small scale levels from 1:4,622,325 to 1:4514

items.name: Great Artesian Basin Digital Data (Geoscience Australia)
items.description: This web service provides access to geological, hydrogeological and hydrochemical digital datasets that have been published by Geoscience Australia for the Great Artesian Basin (GAB).

items.name: Aquifer Groundwater Chemistry
items.description: Chemical parameter concentrations and isotopic variations in groundwater in the Great Artesian Basin for the following aquifers: Adori Sandstone; Cadna-owie - Hooray and equivalents; Hutton Sandstone and Winton-Mackunda Formation.

items.name: Cadna-owie – Hooray Chlorine-36 to chloride ratio
Cadna-owie – Hooray Stable Carbon Isotope Variations
Geological Formation Contact Surfaces
items.description: Contact surfaces between geological formations containing major aquifers and aquitards in the Great Artesian Basin.

items.name: Base of Evergreen and Marburg Formations
Base of Hooray Sandstone and Equivalents
Base of Mackunda Formation and Equivalents
Base of Precipice Sandstone and Equivalents
Potentiometric Surfaces
items.description: Potentiometric surface of the Cadna-owie - Hooray Aquifer in the Great Artesian Basin at 20 year intervals from 1900-2010.

items.name: Polygonal Faulting
items.description: Extent of identified polygonal faulting in the Great Artesian Basin.

items.name: Polygonal Faulting Evident In Seismic Transects
Watertable Elevation
items.description: Watertable elevation of the Great Artesian Basin.

items.name: Alluvium Water Level and GAB Watertable Relationships
